title: Human Resource Generalist
location: Norton Shores Production Facility - Norton Shores, MI
description: The People Operations Generalist will be on site to support our Production facilities in Norton Shores MI. This is where our coffee beans are roasted and our cold brew coffee is brewed! They will lead and support diverse recruiting efforts, manage employee relations, performance development and help build a healthy people culture.  Ensure the people needs of the facilities are met by administering policies and procedures in a fair and consistent way. The People Operations Generalist will possess a high sense of responsibility, quality, ethics, and integrity. RECRUITMENT  Lead best in class sourcing efforts to keep the plant fully staffed with non exempt regular and temporary employees. Screen viable candidates and facilitate interviews with hiring managers.  Partner with Operations to proactively create recruitment plans by properly forecasting hiring needs with emphasis on strategic planning, internal development, and training.   PEOPLE & CULTURE Solve routine HR problems, take the time to suggest modifications to processes and procedures as appropriate. Help build a team and maintain engagement by providing an excellent employee experience. Communicate proactively, professionally, and positively with the team. Facilitate Plant Safety Committee. EMPLOYEE RELATIONS Serve as the primary point of contact for employee relations. Coach supervisory staff with performance issues and employee relations. BEST PRACTICES Possess and maintain working knowledge of trends and regulatory changes. title: Sous Chef
description: SOUS CHEFThe Sous Chef is responsible for the daily execution of our savory grab-and-go program and a small selection of hot food items available exclusively in the Fishtown cafe.  They manage the daily operation of the savory kitchen and can be tasked with hiring, training, team development, menu development, and working stations. They will manage a staff of cooks and dishwashers, and work closely with the back-of-house teams as a trainer and leader but also collaborate with the FOH leaders to maintain alignment with the business.  The Sous Chef will report directly to the Executive Chef, manage a team of approximately 10 people, and oversee sales of approximately $1 million annually in Philadelphia. The Sous Chef possesses a high sense of responsibility, quality, ethics, and integrity.   PEOPLE & CULTURE Study existing menus, and personally develop the techniques needed to execute the menu items. Educate and direct the staff throughout kitchen service. Understand the cleaning schedules and manage all savory kitchen employees including porters. Promote and practice safe work habits through training, education, and documentation of proper procedures. Identify the root cause of safety incidents and rectify them accordingly. Review their team's time punches accurately and timely. Oversee operations of the kitchen to maximize service and enhance the guest experience.   Hold the team accountable for following La Colombe’s policies and procedures. FOOD QUALITY Ensure teams consistently meet food storage and safety standards. Uphold food and presentation quality standards. Learn any menu changes or additions and prepare accordingly. Seek out opportunities to find superior ingredients at a lower cost. Find new ways to grow grab-and-go sales, by testing and executing new items for our fridges.  Find ways to minimize waste, while also managing fully stocked fridges. HEALTH & SAFETY Follow all COVID-19 protocols and meet cleanliness standards. Keeping storage spaces organized and enforcing labeling of all items.  Ensure that all safety protocols are followed even when you are not present. Maintaining log books including temperature and receiving logs. Ensure safety, harassment, injuries, or any other issues brought to your attention are reported and addressed immediately. Complete Monthly Health Inspection Checklist and maintain food service manager health certificate. BUSINESS MANAGEMENTDevelop and maintain a labor schedule that is efficient and cost-effective. Complete payroll and admin tasks accurately and on time. Order all products on a weekly basis and maintain an up-to-date order guide. Assist with building sales consistently and deliberately.  Manage controllable costs effectively. Proactively research, implement, and develop innovative ideas.

The Labor Relations Sr. Manager will respond to union organizing activity and train managers on employee relations matters including card check neutrality (CCN) campaigns. Informs group on a broad range of employment and labor relations matters, including disciplinary actions, contract administration and general methods of positive employee relations.Creates presentations and conducts training to inform operations managers, people partners and leadership regarding labor relations issues. Conducts management training related to Positive Employee Relations and other timely topics.Manages arbitrations, grievances and unfair labor practice charges including drafting, opening and closing briefs.Contributes to the development and improvement of Company-wide standardized practices, processes and forms.Collaborates to ensure legal compliance by reviewing federal, state, and local regulatory requirements and disseminating, explaining, and consulting regarding those requirements.Manages union contracts and is responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with union leadership and agents.Prepares for and assists operations managers and regional leadership in dealing with potential labor disputes, strikes, work stoppages and other concerted activity, including advising on appropriate courses of action involving satisfactory resolution of disputes, security issues, employee concerns and media/public relations considerations.Provides insights on labor relations trends and patterns and translates them into proactive proposals.Facilitates meetings for cross functional stakeholders to evolve policies where appropriate for union and non-union employees, when applicable.Works with external vendors to develop and deliver proposed labor relations related services on-time and within budget.Performs other duties as assigned or requested.

title: Inventory Supervisor
location: MI Warehouse Facility - Norton Shores, MI
description: Responsible for the supervision of the inventory team to ensure accurate and timely inventory data for Michigan. This position requires excellent analytical skills, experience in inventory management and variance analysis to ensure that our raw material and finished good inventory is accurate on a real time basis. title: Sales Rep- Emerging Market - Chicago, IL - Midwest
description: At La Colombe we believe that being a good coffee partner means more than just offering a great cup of coffee. The Wholesale Team supports the city’s most talented chefs, restaurateurs, cafes, offices and hotels to ensure they execute consistent, high quality coffee programs. An emerging market sales rep is responsible for increasing our footprint in an uncharted area. The Sales Representative will own the customer experience, assisting clients to implement and maintain a coffee program that meets La Colombe’s standard of excellence. Source, convert, and onboard new clients to meet business targets. Train and educate client staff on a routine basis in line with specialty coffee techniques. Visit clients, providing preventative maintenance and quality control on a regular cadence. Develop ownership of relationships with key hospitality professionals.  The Sales Representative will display grace under pressure, eagerness to undertake difficult tasks, and a sense of urgency when needed. At La Colombe, no task is too small and the Sales Representative should embody this in all client interactions.  AREAS OF IMPACT SALES Work with Market Sales Manager to target high value leads. Utilize CRM tools to track leads through the sales process and use La Colombe methodology to qualify leads. Negotiate and execute contracts in line with the equipment lending model. Create customized proposals to convert qualified leads into new clients and win business. Collaborate with the Market Sales Manager to develop and implement a strategy to win additional business with key accounts in the market.  CUSTOMER SERVICE Deliver the highest degree of customer service at every stage in the customer experience with thorough, reliable, and timely responses. Communicate in a professional manner with client stakeholders at manager, executive, and ownership levels. Anticipate and proactively take charge of difficult situations finding solutions for clients in line with La Colombe’s resources.  ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT Train baristas, service staff, and management on brewing techniques, extraction theory, and equipment maintenance. Host presentations, tastings, and demonstrations for groups of all sizes. Provide routine quality control and preventative maintenance visits. Assist technician during installs, recipe setting, calibration, and technical service requests. Proactively manage accounts on a day-to-day basis. The aforementioned responsibilities are client facing and in the field. PROJECT MANAGEMENT Provide consultation on all aspects of the coffee business; coffee equipment, product choice, layout design, and general business insights. Communicate and interact effectively with internal departments including client services, technical services, production, marketing, and retail. Work with the Food Service and National Accounts teams to execute complex deals. Maintain a flexible schedule allowing for, when needed, periodic travel, weekends, and after-hours work.  INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE Stay current on new restaurant and hotel openings both locally and nationally. Participate in coffee related events including trade shows, throwdowns, seminars, and other after hours events. Seek out new coffee products, equipment, and industry trends. Establish relationships with chefs, managers, and hospitality staff to improve the network.
